label: 郡
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: a district, several of which composed each ritsuryō province. A district was presided over by a hereditary official known as the district chieftain, or gunji 郡司, whose headquarters was the gunke 郡家. The gunke staff was overseen by four levels of management including a director (dairyō 大領), a vice-director (shōryō 小領), an associate director (shushō 主政) and one or two assistant directors (shuchō 主帳).
